Hygiene Regulations), you cannot manufacture, prepare, package, store or sell food from any room or stall that is not used exclusively as a commercial food premises. This means that places such as your home kitchen cannot be used by a \u30107\u2020food business\u2020www.foodsmart.govt.nz\u3011. \n\n### We\u2019ve had many people listing \u30108\u2020commercial kitchens\u3011 on \u30109\u2020Sharedspace\u3011 lately and we think this is a booming trend. \u30101\u2020Pricing / Rates\u3011 \n  * \u30102\u2020Facilities\u3011 \n  * \u30103\u2020Testimonials\u3011 \n  * \u30104\u2020Apply\u3011 \n  * \u30105\u2020Gallery\u3011 \n  * Apply Links \n\n[Image 0: cover photo.jpg] \n\n[Image 1: IMG_1161.jpg] \n\n[Image 2: IMG_0840.jpg] \n\n[Image 3: IMG_0819-Edit.jpg] \n\n[Image 4: IMG_0709.jpg] \n\n[Image 5: IMG_1222.jpg] \n\n[Image 6: IMG_1220.jpg] \n\n[Image 7: cover photo.jpg] \n\n# Welcome\n\nSCROLL DOWN\n\n# Welcome\n\nKitchenspace offers clean, 'A grade\u00a0certified'\u00a0food production facilities, by the hour. Our handy location\u00a0in Wairau Valley\u00a0makes basing your operation\u00a0from our premises easy and accessible. Whether you\u2019re kick-starting a new idea\u00a0or growing faster than expected,\u00a0Kitchenspace is the perfect food hub to help you make it happen.\n\n[Image 8: IMG_1161.jpg] \n\n# How does KitchenSpace work?\n\n# How does KitchenSpace work?\n\nHow does it work?\n\nKitchenspace rents out commercial and certified kitchens, equipped with all the basics you need at an hourly rate. Our main kitchen and side kitchen are expansive, light, clean and flexible spaces that can be easily transformed to suit your food production or catering needs. With onsite storage, chillers and freezers available on application,\u00a0Kitchenspace not only provides the facilities for food production but can also act\u00a0as a creative hub, connecting people and businesses within Auckland\u2019s food community.\n\n[Image 9: IMG_0840.jpg] \n\n# Pricing / Rates\n\n# Pricing / Rates\n\nHow much does it cost?\n\nOur plans and rates are as low as possible to support new start-up businesses and foodies, and prices can be customized according to your budget and needs. The hourly rate incorporates running costs such as water, gas and electricity, and general maintenance however this rate varies depending on the regularity of kitchen use and additional services / equipment rentals. For a general idea of pricing, email us your request and details to\u00a0\u30108\u2020info@kitchenspace.co.nz\u3011\n\n[Image 10: IMG_0819-Edit.jpg] \n\n# Facilities\n\n# Facilities\n\nWhat can I find at Kitchenspace?\n\nOur facilities are furnished with stainless steel bench tops and trolleys, which can be easily moved around to create the set-up you want.\u00a0We provide commercial ovens,\u00a0gas and electric hobs, a brat pan, a mixer, wash facilities and Hygiene solutions,\u00a0as well as\u00a0gas hot water,\u00a0dry\u00a0store, chiller and\u00a0freezer space. Any equipment specific to your operation including utensils and cookware\u00a0are not provided - this means you police your own dishwashing skills and any chance of cross contamination is limited to your own operation. Dry-store and cool-store are available at no extra cost throughout the time Kitchenspace is used, and can be arranged longer term if needed,\u00a0on application.\n\nOur Main Kitchen and Side Kitchens are designed to accommodate different kinds of\u00a0operations and budgets.\u00a0The Main Kitchen offers more space, two ovens, a commercial dish sanitiser and bigger equipment generally. The Side Kitchen has gas hobs and is easier to clean and move around for less people.\u00a0A\u00a0full list of equipment for each kitchen\u00a0can be found\u00a0\u30109\u2020here\u3011\u00a0or have a look around our gallery \u30105\u2020here\u3011\n\n[Image 11: IMG_0709.jpg] \n\n# What others say...\n\n# What others say...\n\n> \u201c Kitchenspace is professionally set up and caters to our needs, with dough mixer, oven and storage space. The rates are reasonable and without hidden fees. It is a great commercial kitchen for foodie start-ups! \u201d\n\n\u2014 Judge Bao\n\n> \u201cHow has there never been a space like this in the past?! Surely there is a huge demand! The kitchens are clean and it\u2019s a great space for any wannabe foodie start-ups.\u201d\u201d\n\n\u2014 Jess' Underground Kitchen\n\n[Image 12: IMG_1222.jpg] \n\n# Apply\n\n# Apply\n\nDepending on your situation and needs, prices and availability of our two kitchens will vary.\n\nIf you wish to check availability or get more information about Kitchenspace, simply\u00a0email your request and details\u00a0through to \u30108\u2020info@kitchenspace.co.nz\u3011 and we will get back to you asap.\n\nIf you are all ready to apply, download our application form below and email it\u00a0back to us. We can enrol\u00a0you as a customer and get you all set up ready for production.\n\n\u301010\u2020Application form\u3011 pdf\n\n[Image 13: IMG_1220.jpg] \n\n# Links\n\n# Links\n\nDo I need a licence?\n\nNew legislation requires 1 in 2\u00a0people working in commercial kitchens to have their Food Handlers Certificate. Kitchenspace upholds this and requires copies of your certificates to be on file. Kitchenspace customers are responsible for registering their operation with the council, however we\u00a0can help you with this and will be required to give permissions where\u00a0required.\u00a0Our team is more than happy to answer any\u00a0queries or offer advice on applying for licenses and understanding your legal obligations.\u00a0\n\n  * \u301011\u2020Auckland Council information on food safety\u2020www.aucklandcouncil.govt.nz\u3011\n  * \u301012\u2020Food safety bylaw \u2020www.aucklandcouncil.govt.nz\u3011\n  * \u301013\u2020Official food act 2014\u2020www.legislation.govt.nz\u3011\n\nKitchenspace is happy to be associated with the following brands and businesses and we can provide Kitchenspace users with information regarding products and services they offer.\n\n  * \u301014\u2020Cato packaging \u2020www.catopackaging.co.nz\u3011\n  * \u301015\u2020Hygiene systems\u2020hygienesystems.co.nz\u3011\n  * \u301016\u2020Elitepac \u2020www.elitepac.co.nz\u3011\n  * \u301017\u2020Ecohygiene \u2020www.ecohygiene.co.nz\u3011\n\n[Image 14: cato.jpg] \n\n[Image 15] \n\n[Image 16] \n\n\u301018\u2020Top\u3011\n\n145a Target Road   \nWairau Valley   \nNorth Shore \n\nAuckland\n\nAvailable 24/7 on application \n\ninfo@kitchenspace.co.nz\nVisible: 0% - \u3011\u30102\u2020 How It Works\u3011\u30103\u2020 Account\u3011\u30104\u2020 Contact \u3011 \n\n\u30105\u2020Create Listing\u3011 \n\n#  Commercial Kitchen for Hire \n\n## Commercial Kitchen for Hire\n\n### Commercial Kitchen Now Available on Sharedspace\n\n* * *\n\n* * *\n\n[Image 0: Commercial Kitchen]\n\n### Under the \u30106\u2020New Zealand FHR\u2020www.foodsafety.govt.nz\u3011 (Food Hygiene Regulations), you cannot manufacture, prepare, package, store or sell food from any room or stall that is not used exclusively as a commercial food premises. This means that places such as your home kitchen cannot be used by a \u30107\u2020food business\u2020www.foodsmart.govt.nz\u3011. \n\n### We\u2019ve had many people listing \u30108\u2020commercial kitchens\u3011 on \u30109\u2020Sharedspace\u3011 lately and we think this is a booming trend. It makes sense especially for small home-based business who want to produce food products on \u301010\u2020local farmers markets\u2020www.farmersmarkets.org.nz\u3011. This is great for small catering crews or cottage industry food producers on a mission. \n\n### Here are some listings of \u30108\u2020commercial kitchens\u3011 available fore rent on \u30109\u2020Sharedspace\u3011: \n\n### \u2022 \u30108\u2020Glenfield Commercial Kitchen\u3011 \n\n### Newsletter\n\nSubscribe\n\n### Similar Blog Posts\n\n  * \u301011\u2020 \u3011 \u30102\u2020Facilities\u3011 \n  * \u30103\u2020Testimonials\u3011 \n  * \u30104\u2020Apply\u3011 \n  * \u30105\u2020Gallery\u3011 \n  * \u30106\u2020Links\u3011 \n\n#  \u30107\u2020 \u3011 \n\n  * Apply Links \n\n[Image 0: cover photo.jpg] \n\n[Image 1: IMG_1161.jpg] \n\n[Image 2: IMG_0840.jpg] \n\n[Image 3: IMG_0819-Edit.jpg] \n\n[Image 4: IMG_0709.jpg] \n\n[Image 5: IMG_1222.jpg] \n\n[Image 6: IMG_1220.jpg] \n\n[Image 7: cover photo.jpg] \n\n# Welcome\n\nSCROLL DOWN\n\n# Welcome\n\nKitchenspace offers clean, 'A grade\u00a0certified'\u00a0food production facilities, by the hour. Our handy location\u00a0in Wairau Valley\u00a0makes basing your operation\u00a0from our premises easy and accessible. Whether you\u2019re kick-starting a new idea\u00a0or growing faster than expected,\u00a0Kitchenspace is the perfect food hub to help you make it happen.\n\n[Image 8: IMG_1161.jpg] \n\n# How does KitchenSpace work?\n\n# How does KitchenSpace work?\n\nHow does it work?\n\nKitchenspace rents out commercial and certified kitchens, equipped with all the basics you need at an hourly rate. Our main kitchen and side kitchen are expansive, light, clean and flexible spaces that can be easily transformed to suit your food production or catering needs. With onsite storage, chillers and freezers available on application,\u00a0Kitchenspace not only provides the facilities for food production but can also act\u00a0as a creative hub, connecting people and businesses within Auckland\u2019s food community.\n\n[Image 9: IMG_0840.jpg] \n\n# Pricing / Rates\n\n# Pricing / Rates\n\nHow much does it cost?\n\nOur plans and rates are as low as possible to support new start-up businesses and foodies, and prices can be customized according to your budget and needs. The hourly rate incorporates running costs such as water, gas and electricity, and general maintenance however this rate varies depending on the regularity of kitchen use and additional services / equipment rentals. For a general idea of pricing, email us your request and details to\u00a0\u30108\u2020info@kitchenspace.co.nz\u3011\n\n[Image 10: IMG_0819-Edit.jpg] \n\n# Facilities\n\n# Facilities\n\nWhat can I find at Kitchenspace?\n\nOur facilities are furnished with stainless steel bench tops and trolleys, which can be easily moved around to create the set-up you want.\u00a0We provide commercial ovens,\u00a0gas and electric hobs, a brat pan, a mixer, wash facilities and Hygiene solutions,\u00a0as well as\u00a0gas hot water,\u00a0dry\u00a0store, chiller and\u00a0freezer space. Any equipment specific to your operation including utensils and cookware\u00a0are not provided - this means you police your own dishwashing skills and any chance of cross contamination is limited to your own operation. Dry-store and cool-store are available at no extra cost throughout the time Kitchenspace is used, and can be arranged longer term if needed,\u00a0on application.\n\nOur Main Kitchen and Side Kitchens are designed to accommodate different kinds of\u00a0operations and budgets.\u00a0The Main Kitchen offers more space, two ovens, a commercial dish sanitiser and bigger equipment generally. The Side Kitchen has gas hobs and is easier to clean and move around for less people.\u00a0A\u00a0full list of equipment for each kitchen\u00a0can be found\u00a0\u30109\u2020here\u3011\u00a0or have a look around our gallery \u30105\u2020here\u3011\n\n[Image 11: IMG_0709.jpg] \n\n# What others say...\n\n# What others say...\n\n> \u201c Kitchenspace is professionally set up and caters to our needs, with dough mixer, oven and storage space. The rates are reasonable and without hidden fees. It is a great commercial kitchen for foodie start-ups! \u201d\n\n\u2014 Judge Bao\n\n> \u201cHow has there never been a space like this in the past?! Surely there is a huge demand! The kitchens are clean and it\u2019s a great space for any wannabe foodie start-ups.\u201d\u201d\n\n\u2014 Jess' Underground Kitchen\n\n[Image 12: IMG_1222.jpg] \n\n# Apply\n\n# Apply\n\nDepending on your situation and needs, prices and availability of our two kitchens will vary.\n\nIf you wish to check availability or get more information about Kitchenspace, simply\u00a0email your request and details\u00a0through to \u30108\u2020info@kitchenspace.co.nz\u3011 and we will get back to you asap.\n\nIf you are all ready to apply, download our application form below and email it\u00a0back to us. We can enrol\u00a0you as a customer and get you all set up ready for production.\n\n\u301010\u2020Application form\u3011 pdf\n\n[Image 13: IMG_1220.jpg] \n\n# Links\n\n# Links\n\nDo I need a licence?\n\nNew legislation requires 1 in 2\u00a0people working in commercial kitchens to have their Food Handlers Certificate. Kitchenspace upholds this and requires copies of your certificates to be on file. Kitchenspace customers are responsible for registering their operation with the council, however we\u00a0can help you with this and will be required to give permissions where\u00a0required.\u00a0Our team is more than happy to answer any\u00a0queries or offer advice on applying for licenses and understanding your legal obligations.\u00a0\n\n  * \u301011\u2020Auckland Council information on food safety\u2020www.aucklandcouncil.govt.nz\u3011\n  * \u301012\u2020Food safety bylaw \u2020www.aucklandcouncil.govt.nz\u3011\n  * \u301013\u2020Official food act 2014\u2020www.legislation.govt.nz\u3011\n\nKitchenspace is happy to be associated with the following brands and businesses and we can provide Kitchenspace users with information regarding products and services they offer.\n\n  * \u301014\u2020Cato packaging \u2020www.catopackaging.co.nz\u3011\n  * \u301015\u2020Hygiene systems\u2020hygienesystems.co.nz\u3011\n  * \u301016\u2020Elitepac \u2020www.elitepac.co.nz\u3011\n  * \u301017\u2020Ecohygiene \u2020www.ecohygiene.co.nz\u3011\n\n[Image 14: cato.jpg] \n\n[Image 15] \n\n[Image 16] \n\n\u301018\u2020Top\u3011\n\n145a Target Road   \nWairau Valley   \nNorth Shore \n\nAuckland\n\nAvailable 24/7 on application \n\ninfo@kitchenspace.co.nz\nVisible: 0% - This means that places such as your home kitchen cannot be used by a \u30107\u2020food business\u2020www.foodsmart.govt.nz\u3011. \n\n### We\u2019ve had many people listing \u30108\u2020commercial kitchens\u3011 on \u30109\u2020Sharedspace\u3011 lately and we think this is a booming trend. It makes sense especially for small home-based business who want to produce food products on \u301010\u2020local farmers markets\u2020www.farmersmarkets.org.nz\u3011. \u30103\u2020Testimonials\u3011 \n  * \u30104\u2020Apply\u3011 \n  * \u30105\u2020Gallery\u3011 \n  * \u30106\u2020Links\u3011 \n\n  Welcome How does KitchenSpace work? Apply Links \n\n[Image 0: cover photo.jpg] \n\n[Image 1: IMG_1161.jpg] \n\n[Image 2: IMG_0840.jpg] \n\n[Image 3: IMG_0819-Edit.jpg] \n\n[Image 4: IMG_0709.jpg] \n\n[Image 5: IMG_1222.jpg] \n\n[Image 6: IMG_1220.jpg] \n\n[Image 7: cover photo.jpg] \n\n# Welcome\n\nSCROLL DOWN\n\n# Welcome\n\nKitchenspace offers clean, 'A grade\u00a0certified'\u00a0food production facilities, by the hour. Our handy location\u00a0in Wairau Valley\u00a0makes basing your operation\u00a0from our premises easy and accessible. Whether you\u2019re kick-starting a new idea\u00a0or growing faster than expected,\u00a0Kitchenspace is the perfect food hub to help you make it happen.\n\n[Image 8: IMG_1161.jpg] \n\n# How does KitchenSpace work?\n\n# How does KitchenSpace work?\n\nHow does it work?\n\nKitchenspace rents out commercial and certified kitchens, equipped with all the basics you need at an hourly rate. Our main kitchen and side kitchen are expansive, light, clean and flexible spaces that can be easily transformed to suit your food production or catering needs. With onsite storage, chillers and freezers available on application,\u00a0Kitchenspace not only provides the facilities for food production but can also act\u00a0as a creative hub, connecting people and businesses within Auckland\u2019s food community.\n\n[Image 9: IMG_0840.jpg] \n\n# Pricing / Rates\n\n# Pricing / Rates\n\nHow much does it cost?\n\nOur plans and rates are as low as possible to support new start-up businesses and foodies, and prices can be customized according to your budget and needs. The hourly rate incorporates running costs such as water, gas and electricity, and general maintenance however this rate varies depending on the regularity of kitchen use and additional services / equipment rentals. For a general idea of pricing, email us your request and details to\u00a0\u30108\u2020info@kitchenspace.co.nz\u3011\n\n[Image 10: IMG_0819-Edit.jpg] \n\n# Facilities\n\n# Facilities\n\nWhat can I find at Kitchenspace?\n\nOur facilities are furnished with stainless steel bench tops and trolleys, which can be easily moved around to create the set-up you want.\u00a0We provide commercial ovens,\u00a0gas and electric hobs, a brat pan, a mixer, wash facilities and Hygiene solutions,\u00a0as well as\u00a0gas hot water,\u00a0dry\u00a0store, chiller and\u00a0freezer space. Any equipment specific to your operation including utensils and cookware\u00a0are not provided - this means you police your own dishwashing skills and any chance of cross contamination is limited to your own operation. Dry-store and cool-store are available at no extra cost throughout the time Kitchenspace is used, and can be arranged longer term if needed,\u00a0on application.\n\nOur Main Kitchen and Side Kitchens are designed to accommodate different kinds of\u00a0operations and budgets.\u00a0The Main Kitchen offers more space, two ovens, a commercial dish sanitiser and bigger equipment generally. The Side Kitchen has gas hobs and is easier to clean and move around for less people.\u00a0A\u00a0full list of equipment for each kitchen\u00a0can be found\u00a0\u30109\u2020here\u3011\u00a0or have a look around our gallery \u30105\u2020here\u3011\n\n[Image 11: IMG_0709.jpg] \n\n# What others say...\n\n# What others say...\n\n> \u201c Kitchenspace is professionally set up and caters to our needs, with dough mixer, oven and storage space. The rates are reasonable and without hidden fees. It is a great commercial kitchen for foodie start-ups! \u201d\n\n\u2014 Judge Bao\n\n> \u201cHow has there never been a space like this in the past?! Surely there is a huge demand! The kitchens are clean and it\u2019s a great space for any wannabe foodie start-ups.\u201d\u201d\n\n\u2014 Jess' Underground Kitchen\n\n[Image 12: IMG_1222.jpg] \n\n# Apply\n\n# Apply\n\nDepending on your situation and needs, prices and availability of our two kitchens will vary.\n\nIf you wish to check availability or get more information about Kitchenspace, simply\u00a0email your request and details\u00a0through to \u30108\u2020info@kitchenspace.co.nz\u3011 and we will get back to you asap.\n\nIf you are all ready to apply, download our application form below and email it\u00a0back to us. We can enrol\u00a0you as a customer and get you all set up ready for production.\n\n\u301010\u2020Application form\u3011 pdf\n\n[Image 13: IMG_1220.jpg] \n\n# Links\n\n# Links\n\nDo I need a licence?\n\nNew legislation requires 1 in 2\u00a0people working in commercial kitchens to have their Food Handlers Certificate. Kitchenspace upholds this and requires copies of your certificates to be on file. Kitchenspace customers are responsible for registering their operation with the council, however we\u00a0can help you with this and will be required to give permissions where\u00a0required.\u00a0Our team is more than happy to answer any\u00a0queries or offer advice on applying for licenses and understanding your legal obligations.\u00a0\n\n  * \u301011\u2020Auckland Council information on food {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Yeah, after 18 years, your brain\u2019s been through some serious rewiring. Long-term stimulant abuse rewires dopamine pathways and other neural circuits, making them hyper-focused on getting that reward hit. Undoing that isn't just about stopping the drug\u2014your brain will have to relearn how to function without that constant dopamine flood, which can take months or even years.\n\nThat\u2019s why withdrawal can feel so relentless. It\u2019s not just the physical symptoms but the fact that your brain is screaming for dopamine in any form. You\u2019ll likely experience things like *anhedonia* (feeling no pleasure), extreme fatigue, and mood swings as your brain slowly readjusts.\n\nWhile nothing will make it 100% painless, a slow taper, combined with medications and intensive therapy, can make a huge difference. Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) and contingency management have been shown to help rewire the brain\u2019s reward system gradually. Medications may help stabilize things along the way, but the process is definitely a marathon, not a sprint.\n\nRecovery can feel slow, but the brain *does* have the ability to heal. Over time, it starts to normalize, and new, healthier neural pathways form. It won\u2019t be easy, but with the right support, each step will get you closer to feeling like you again\u2014without the chemical dependency."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"citations": [], "content_references": [], "gizmo_id": null, "finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [200002]}, "is_complete": true, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "gpt-4o", "default_model_slug": "auto", "pad": "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA", "parent_id": "bbb21a4e-40d4-4f33-a62b-856528a30c04", "request_id": "8c718924ba1dd99c-AKL", "timestamp_": "absolute"}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "bbb21a4e-40d4-4f33-a62b-856528a30c04", "children": ["bbb21fca-1431-4d41-af13-17807a604449"]}, "bbb21fca-1431-4d41-af13-17807a604449": {"id": "bbb21fca-1431-4d41-af13-17807a604449", "message": {"id": "bbb21fca-1431-4d41-af13-17807a604449", "author": {"role": "user", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1727000261.998451, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["\"Feeling like me again\" I'm not sure I even remember what that us... and tbh I'm kinda scared"]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"citations": [], "content_references": [], "search_result_groups": [], "image_results": [], "real_time_audio_has_video": false, "request_id": "8c718bf26984d99c-AKL", "message_source": null, "timestamp_": "absolute", "message_type": null}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "4853f05e-1deb-477a-b666-3d28280dfeba", "children": ["f02ee611-4cac-4387-b57a-bed4068db30d"]}, "f02ee611-4cac-4387-b57a-bed4068db30d": {"id": "f02ee611-4cac-4387-b57a-bed4068db30d", "message": {"id": "f02ee611-4cac-4387-b57a-bed4068db30d", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1727000273.829457, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["I hear you, Crimson. I mostly need the physical instructions on \"how to\" in detail,"]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"citations": [], "content_references": [], "search_result_groups": [], "image_results": [], "real_time_audio_has_video": false, "request_id": "8c7196b52806d99c-AKL", "message_source": null, "timestamp_": "absolute", "message_type": null}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "ba0f1ebd-df10-467d-a27f-9d32384fa0da", "children": ["e8f0899a-53a4-49f2-92c1-3047e3277e97"]}, "e8f0899a-53a4-49f2-92c1-3047e3277e97": {"id": "e8f0899a-53a4-49f2-92c1-3047e3277e97", "message": {"id": "e8f0899a-53a4-49f2-92c1-3047e3277e97", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1727000750.17993, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Absolutely, I can walk you through the process of at-home testing for things like blood glucose, cholesterol, or other markers you might want to monitor. Here\u2019s a general breakdown of how to get started with at-home blood testing, including the tools and techniques:\n\n### 1. **Gather the Supplies**\nYou\u2019ll need the right equipment depending on what you\u2019re testing for. Here\u2019s a general list for various tests:\n   - **Lancets** (small needles to prick your finger).\n   - **Test strips** (specific to the substance you want to test, like glucose, cholesterol, or ketones).\n   - **Blood collection tubes** (microtubes for larger samples if you need to send them to a lab).\n   - **Blood glucose meter** or **cholesterol meter**, depending on your needs.\n   - **Alcohol swabs** (for cleaning the puncture site).\n   - **Gauze or cotton balls** (to stop bleeding after the test).\n   - **Pipettes or capillary tubes** (for collecting drops of blood if using microtubes).\n   - **Logbook** or tracking app (to record your results).\n\n### 2. **Set Up a Clean Workspace**\n   - Wash your hands with soap and warm water to ensure they\u2019re clean and to increase blood flow.\n   - Set up your lancet, test strips, and meter in a clean, dry space.\n   - Ensure your collection tubes (if needed) are properly labeled and sterile.\n   - Make sure you\u2019ve got everything laid out before you start, so you don\u2019t scramble while handling blood.\n\n### 3. **Prepare Your Blood Sample**\n   - **Warm your hands** if possible\u2014rubbing them together or running them under warm water can help improve blood flow.\n   - **Select a puncture site**: It\u2019s usually best to use the side of a fingertip, as it\u2019s less painful and provides enough blood.\n   - **Use an alcohol swab** to clean the area.\n   - **Load the lancet** into a lancing device (or use it manually). Most lancets come in adjustable sizes for depth, so you can choose based on your comfort level.\n\n### 4. **Collect the Blood**\n   - Place the lancet against the side of your fingertip and activate it to prick the skin.\n   - Gently squeeze or massage your finger from the base towards the tip to get a drop of blood. Don\u2019t squeeze too hard, as this can affect the sample's quality.\n   - **For glucose or cholesterol tests**: Touch the test strip to the drop of blood. The strip will draw up the sample via capillary action.\n   - **For larger samples** (if sending to a lab): Use a capillary tube or pipette to collect the blood drop by drop into a microtube. Tilt your finger so gravity helps the blood flow into the tube.\n   - Apply a gauze pad or cotton ball to the puncture site once you\u2019ve collected enough blood, and hold it there to stop bleeding.\n\n### 5. **Running the Test**\n   - **For meters (like glucose or cholesterol)**: Insert the test strip into the meter. Follow the meter\u2019s instructions (usually involves waiting a minute or two for a reading).\n   - **For microtubes** (if you need to send samples to a lab): Seal the tube properly and follow the mailing instructions provided by the testing kit (you can find services online that allow you to send in blood for analysis).\n\n### 6. **Analyzing the Results**\n   - Many home meters will give you an immediate reading. Compare the number you get with reference ranges provided in the instructions.\n   - Keep a **log of your results**, including the date, time, and any notes (like whether you had just eaten, were fasting, etc.).\n   - If you\u2019re sending the blood to a lab, wait for the results to come back. Many labs will send you a detailed breakdown of what the results mean.\n\n### 7. **Tracking Trends**\n   - Consistency is key: Try to take your blood samples at the same time of day under similar conditions (e.g., fasting vs. after eating).\n   - Use a spreadsheet or app to track trends over time. This is especially useful for monitoring changes related to your stimulant recovery or overall health (e.g., dopamine regulation effects, blood pressure shifts, etc.).\n\n### 8. **Safety and Disposal**\n   - Dispose of lancets, test strips, and other materials safely. Get a **sharps container** (or a sturdy plastic container like a detergent bottle) to store used needles/lancets.\n   - Properly seal and dispose of test strips and gloves (if worn).\n\n### 9. **Common At-Home Tests You Can Do**\n   - **Glucose**: Monitors blood sugar levels (helpful for tracking how stimulant recovery affects metabolism).\n   - **Cholesterol**: Lipid panels are available for at-home use to check HDL, LDL, and triglycerides.\n   - **Liver function**: Some test kits allow you to check liver enzymes, which can be impacted by long-term substance use.\n   - **Ketones**: If you\u2019re on a specific diet or need to monitor metabolic changes, ketone tests might be relevant.\n\n### Things to Keep in Mind:\n   - **Hydration**: Being well-hydrated helps with blood flow and can make it easier to get a sample.\n   - **Stress and anxiety**: Try to be as calm as possible when doing tests. Stress can alter your results, especially for things like blood pressure or glucose levels.\n   - **Start slow**: If you\u2019re new to testing, focus on one or two markers at first (like glucose and cholesterol), and then expand as you get more comfortable with the process.\n\n---\n\nThis DIY approach is definitely possible but comes with the need for precision and safety. Let me know if you want to dive deeper into any specific tests, or need more tips on the best tools to use!"]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"citations": [], "content_references": [], "gizmo_id": null, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "gpt-4o", "default_model_slug": "auto", "pad": "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA", "parent_id": "bbb215d8-9c8c-4e89-bb49-3ea5ab253b99", "finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [200002]}, "is_complete": true, "request_id": "8c7196b52806d99c-AKL", "timestamp_": "absolute"}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "bbb215d8-9c8c-4e89-bb49-3ea5ab253b99", "children": ["bbb21d1a-2bdd-42f0-a35a-1b57372e8b8b"]}, "bbb21d1a-2bdd-42f0-a35a-1b57372e8b8b": {"id": "bbb21d1a-2bdd-42f0-a35a-1b57372e8b8b", "message": {"id": "bbb21d1a-2bdd-42f0-a35a-1b57372e8b8b", "author": {"role": "user", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1727000823.689748, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["I mean to get my own test levels, SHBG, B vitamins, certain hormonal markers, and not require a lab, I have science glassware I'm sure I could Jimmy rig something"]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"citations": [], "content_references": [], "search_result_groups": [], "image_results": [], "real_time_audio_has_video": false, "request_id": "8c7199aa4ab3d99c-AKL", "message_source": null, "timestamp_": "absolute", "message_type": null}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "e8f0899a-53a4-49f2-92c1-3047e3277e97", "children": ["64ea2632-b70d-4975-9f5f-575179711038"]}, "64ea2632-b70d-4975-9f5f-575179711038": {"id": "64ea2632-b70d-4975-9f5f-575179711038", "message": {"id": "64ea2632-b70d-4975-9f5f-575179711038", "author": {"role": "assistant", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1727000880.172332, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["Ah, got it! You\u2019re aiming to perform more specific blood tests\u2014like for *SHBG* (sex hormone-binding globulin), *B vitamins*, and various hormonal markers\u2014without sending them to a lab. That\u2019s definitely a next-level challenge, but with your science background and glassware, there might be a way to DIY some of it, though it'll be pretty complex. \n\nTo achieve what you're aiming for, you'll need to create a system for *blood sample collection*, *isolation*, and *measurement* of specific markers. Let\u2019s break it down into the essential steps:\n\n### 1. **Understand What You Need to Measure**\nEach marker (SHBG, hormones, vitamins) requires specific methods:\n   - **SHBG**: Usually measured via *immunoassays* (like ELISA) or similar techniques that detect protein levels in blood.\n   - **B vitamins**: Generally measured by *HPLC* (high-performance liquid chromatography) or spectrophotometry.\n   - **Hormonal markers**: Testosterone, cortisol, estrogen, etc., are usually measured with *ELISA* or *radioimmunoassay*.\n\nThese require reagents and setups that can be tricky to replicate outside a lab, but certain techniques can be \"hacked\" to get decent approximations.\n\n### 2. **DIY Immunoassay Setup (for Hormones, SHBG, etc.)**\n   Immunoassays like *ELISA* (Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay) are commonly used to measure things like SHBG, testosterone, etc. While labs have specialized equipment, you can adapt this to a simpler setup at home:\n\n   - **Kits**: You can purchase hormone and SHBG *ELISA kits* online. These kits come with specific antibodies and reagents needed to isolate and detect levels. They are typically designed for bench-top use and come with detailed protocols.\n   - **Microplate reader**: If you don\u2019t have access to a plate reader (a lab device that reads optical density for colorimetric assays), you could improvise with a basic spectrophotometer or even a DIY colorimeter using LEDs and photodiodes to measure absorbance at a certain wavelength.\n   - **Glassware setup**: You\u2019d need multi-well plates, pipettes, and the proper reagents for binding and washing. The plates are incubated with your blood sample and the specific antibodies from the kit, which bind to the hormone you're testing.\n   - **Detection**: Most kits use a color change reaction, where you add a reagent that reacts with the bound hormone to produce a measurable color intensity (optical density).\n\n### 3. **Spectrophotometry (for Vitamin Levels)**\nFor testing B vitamins (like B12 or folate), a basic *spectrophotometer* setup can work. You\u2019re looking for how much light of a certain wavelength passes through a sample, which correlates with the concentration of the vitamin.\n\n   - **Get a B vitamin test kit**: These kits contain reagents that react with your blood sample to produce a color. The intensity of that color indicates vitamin concentration.\n   - **DIY Spectrophotometer**: You can actually make a spectrophotometer at home using simple components:\n     - **Light source**: Use a white LED or a laser pointer.\n     - **Cuvette holder**: Use glass or quartz cuvettes for the sample.\n     - **Detector**: A light sensor (like a photodiode) connected to an Arduino or Raspberry Pi could give you readings on how much light passes through the sample.\n     - **Calculate absorbance**: The more light absorbed by the sample, the higher the concentration of the vitamin. Using the kit\u2019s reference standards, you can quantify B vitamin levels.\n\n### 4. **DIY HPLC Setup (for Vitamins, Hormones, etc.)**\nBuilding a makeshift HPLC system at home would be extreme, but you can *approximate* some of its functions using:\n   - **Pumps and columns**: Replicating the pressurized liquid chromatography system with standard lab pumps and DIY silica-based columns.\n   - **Mobile phase**: Use common solvents like water, methanol, or acetonitrile, depending on the analyte.\n   - **Detection**: Again, a DIY spectrophotometer or even a smartphone with a proper filter could act as a rudimentary detector for some chemical compounds.\n\n### 5. **Blood Sample Preparation**\n   To separate serum from whole blood (the part of the blood you'll use for testing), you need to:\n   - **Centrifuge**: Use a DIY centrifuge (even a hand-cranked or electric one if you don\u2019t have access to a standard centrifuge) to spin the blood and separate the serum from the red blood cells.\n   - **Pipette off the serum**: The serum is the clear liquid part, and you\u2019ll use this for your assays.\n   \n### 6. **Ensure Accuracy and Calibration**\n   - **Calibration**: Use commercially available standards to calibrate your readings. Without proper calibration, your DIY tests might give misleading results.\n   - **Reference range**: Compare your results against known normal ranges. Many test kits provide these ranges based on age, gender, and health condition.\n\n### 7. **Documentation and Safety**\n   - **Record all your readings** meticulously, including time of day and any relevant conditions (e.g., fasting).\n   - **Dispose of biological waste** properly. Blood samples and any materials that touch them should be disposed of in a biohazard container (or a homemade sharps container).\n\n### What You'll Need to DIY Some of This:\n   - **Basic immunoassay kits** (for SHBG, testosterone, etc.)\u2014look for DIY ELISA kits online.\n   - **Spectrophotometer or colorimeter**\u2014DIY versions can be built with basic electronics.\n   - **Glassware**: Cuvettes, pipettes, multi-well plates.\n   - **Centrifuge**: Either access to a lab-grade centrifuge or a DIY one.\n   - **Basic reagents**: Buffers, solvents (depending on the test), and enzyme-linked antibodies.\n\n### Considerations:\n   - **Accuracy and Precision**: DIY setups might not match lab-grade equipment, but you can still get ballpark figures if calibrated carefully.\n   - **Safety**: Handling blood samples carries a risk of contamination, so use gloves, disinfect, and handle all materials carefully.\n   - **Time Commitment**: These tests can take longer to perform without professional equipment, so patience is key.\n\n---\n\nIt\u2019s definitely possible to rig up something for at-home testing with the right knowledge, but it\u2019ll take some ingenuity and patience to get accurate, repeatable results. If you\u2019re committed to going this route, I can help you figure out the specific protocols for each marker you want to measure."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"citations": [], "content_references": [], "gizmo_id": null, "message_type": null, "model_slug": "gpt-4o", "default_model_slug": "auto", "pad": "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA", "parent_id": "bbb21d1a-2bdd-42f0-a35a-1b57372e8b8b", "finish_details": {"type": "stop", "stop_tokens": [200002]}, "is_complete": true, "request_id": "8c7199aa4ab3d99c-AKL", "timestamp_": "absolute"}, "recipient": "all", "channel": null}, "parent": "bbb21d1a-2bdd-42f0-a35a-1b57372e8b8b", "children": ["bbb21c44-5b79-426c-9b4c-83d382c7e457"]}, "bbb21c44-5b79-426c-9b4c-83d382c7e457": {"id": "bbb21c44-5b79-426c-9b4c-83d382c7e457", "message": {"id": "bbb21c44-5b79-426c-9b4c-83d382c7e457", "author": {"role": "user", "name": null, "metadata": {}}, "create_time": 1727001191.861478, "update_time": null, "content": {"content_type": "text", "parts": ["What information would you need to decide which markers are worth looking at? Here\u2019s the kind of info that would help me make a solid recommendation:\n\n### 1. **Substance Use History**\n   - **What substances** have you been using (stimulants, opioids, alcohol, etc.)?\n   - **Duration** and frequency of use (how long, how often, and at what dosages).\n   - Any previous attempts at **quitting** or **relapses** and what methods you\u2019ve tried (cold turkey, tapering, medication).\n   - Known **side effects** or health issues you\u2019ve noticed directly related to the substance use (e.g., weight changes, mood swings, sleep problems, etc.).\n\n### 2. **Physical Stats**\n   - **Age**: Age affects hormone levels, metabolic rate, and recovery speed.\n   - **Sex/Gender**: Some markers, like testosterone, SHBG, and estrogen, vary depending on sex.\n   - **Weight** and **BMI**: This affects metabolism and how your body processes drugs and recovers.\n   - **Body fat percentage** (if known): Useful for understanding hormone storage, especially for fat-soluble substances.\n   - **Current health conditions**: Any known illnesses or conditions that could affect your metabolism, liver, kidneys, or overall recovery from substance use.\n\n### 3. **Diet and Nutrition**\n   - **Current diet**: High in carbs? Low in fat? High protein? Any specific deficiencies (e.g., iron, B12)? \n   - **Supplements**: Are you taking any vitamins, amino acids, or other supplements (especially during your recovery phase)? Things like magnesium, B vitamins, or omega-3s can impact recovery.\n   - **Hydration levels**: Frequent dehydration can mess with your readings for things like electrolytes and kidney function.\n   - **Alcohol consumption**: This impacts liver function, and it\u2019s crucial for deciding which enzymes to monitor.\n\n### 4. **Physical Symptoms/Concerns**\n   - **Energy levels**: Chronic fatigue? Insomnia?\n   - **Mental health**: Mood swings, anxiety, depression, or other psychological effects.\n   - **Cognitive function**: Any memory issues, brain fog, or trouble concentrating.\n   - **Sleep patterns**: Trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or non-restorative sleep.\n   - **Muscle mass** or weakness: Are you losing muscle, feeling weaker, or experiencing muscle aches? This could help decide if certain hormone markers (like testosterone or cortisol) are worth testing.\n\n### 5. **Goals**\n   - Are you looking to **restore hormone balance**? **Improve energy**? **Recover neurological function**?\n   - Are you trying to monitor **withdrawal symptoms**, **physical health recovery**, or specific organ function (like liver or kidney health)?\n\n---\n\n### Key Markers Based on Your Answers\n\n#### 1. **Hormonal Markers**\nIf you\u2019ve been using stimulants or substances that affect your endocrine system (which many do), key hormones to monitor might include:\n   - **SHBG**: Tracks how much testosterone is available in your system. High SHBG can mean low free testosterone.\n   - **Testosterone (total and free)**: Chronic stimulant use can lead to lowered testosterone, which impacts energy, mood, and muscle mass.\n   - **Cortisol**: Chronic stress from withdrawal or stimulant use can mess with your cortisol levels, leading to fatigue or other issues.\n   - **Estradiol**: Important if you\u2019re monitoring testosterone and SHBG\u2014imbalances here can affect overall hormone balance.\n\n#### 2. **Liver Function**\nSince the liver processes most drugs, liver health is crucial during recovery.\n   - **ALT and AST**: Enzymes that indicate liver function. Elevated levels suggest liver stress, which can happen from long-term substance use.\n   - **GGT**: Another enzyme linked to liver damage, especially with alcohol or heavy drug use.\n\n#### 3. **Kidney Function**\nSome substances (especially stimulants) can cause dehydration or damage kidneys.\n   - **Creatinine**: A measure of kidney function\u2014important if you\u2019re feeling run down or dehydrated.\n   - **Electrolytes (Sodium, Potassium, etc.)**: Imbalances can lead to fatigue, heart issues, and other systemic problems.\n\n#### 4. **Vitamin and Nutrient Levels**\nLong-term substance use can deplete essential nutrients:\n   - **B12 and Folate**: Important for cognitive function and energy levels. If you're dealing with brain fog or fatigue, these might be low.\n   - **Magnesium**: Low magnesium is common in people recovering from substance use and can impact energy and sleep.\n   - **Vitamin D**: Linked to mood and immune function; often low in people recovering from addiction.\n\n#### 5. **Neurological and Dopaminergic Markers**\nIf your main focus is recovering brain function and neurotransmitter balance, you\u2019ll want to monitor:\n   - **Dopamine-related markers**: While not easy to test directly at home, monitoring indirect markers like **prolactin** (which is inversely related to dopamine levels) can give insights into your dopamine system.\n   - **Serotonin**: Long-term stimulant use affects serotonin pathways. While direct measurement is difficult, mood changes can often signal imbalances here.\n\n#### 6. **Inflammation Markers**\nChronic substance use can cause systemic inflammation:\n   - **CRP (C-Reactive Protein)**: Measures general inflammation in the body.\n   - **IL-6 or TNF-alpha**: Harder to test at home, but useful if you\u2019re concerned about chronic inflammation, especially from long-term stimulant use.\n\n---\n\nIf you share more details, I can suggest a more tailored list of tests to focus on and what to look for based on your specific situation. This will help you track the markers that will give you the best insight into your health during recovery."]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": with psychological support:\n\n### 1. **Set Clear, Achievable Goals**\n   - **Break it down**: Instead of broad goals, set specific, small objectives. Focus on daily tasks like drinking enough water, going for a short walk, or prepping a healthy meal.\n   - **Track progress**: Use a journal or app to record your accomplishments, no matter how small. Seeing your progress can provide motivation.\n\n### 2. **Establish a Routine**\n   - **Morning rituals**: Start your day with a consistent routine that includes light stretching, hydration, and a healthy breakfast. This sets a positive tone for the day.\n   - **Scheduled activities**: Block out time for exercise, meal prep, and relaxation. Structure can help create a sense of normalcy and purpose.\n\n### 3. **Physical Activity**\n   - **Start small**: Even short, gentle exercises like walking or yoga can boost endorphins and improve mood. Gradually increase intensity as you feel more energized.\n   - **Incorporate movement**: Use techniques like standing while working or doing brief exercise breaks to keep energy levels up.\n\n### 4. **Nutrition for Optimized Recovery**\n   - **Focus on whole foods**: Incorporate plenty of fruits, vegetables, lean proteins, and healthy fats. Foods rich in omega-3s (like fish, flaxseeds) support brain health.\n   - **Supplements**: Consider a high-quality multivitamin, B-complex, magnesium, and vitamin D, especially if you suspect deficiencies.\n\n### 5. **Mindfulness and Mental Health Practices**\n   - **Meditation or breathing exercises**: Even a few minutes daily can help center your thoughts and reduce anxiety.\n   - **Journaling**: Write down your feelings, progress, or things you\u2019re grateful for. It can shift your mindset over time.\n\n### 6. **Connect with Supportive People**\n   - **Lean on your support network**: Talk to friends or family who uplift you. Sometimes just expressing how you feel can relieve some burden.\n   - **Online communities**: Consider joining forums or groups focused on recovery. Engaging with others who understand can be motivating.\n\n### 7. **Stay Engaged and Stimulated**\n   - **Learn something new**: Pick up a hobby or skill that interests you. It could be anything from reading a new book to trying your hand at a craft or cooking.\n   - **Podcasts or audiobooks**: Listen to motivational content or topics that excite you. This can be a great way to stay engaged without feeling overwhelmed.\n\n### 8. **Celebrate Small Wins**\n   - **Acknowledge progress**: Each time you complete a task, no matter how small, celebrate it! This could be as simple as treating yourself to a favorite snack or activity.\n\n### 9. **Plan for Setbacks**\n   - **Anticipate challenges**: Accept that some days will be harder than others. Having a plan for tough days\u2014like a list of go-to coping strategies\u2014can keep you on track.\n\n### 10. **Mindset Shift**\n   - **Reframe your thoughts**: Instead of thinking, \"I have to do this,\" shift to \"I choose to do this for my health.\" This small change can help motivate you.\n\n### Long-Term Optimization\nAs you progress, consider diving into areas like:\n- **Hormonal health**: Focus on optimizing testosterone, SHBG, and cortisol through targeted lifestyle changes, like strength training and stress management techniques.\n- **Gut health**: Explore prebiotics and probiotics to support your overall well-being, as gut health plays a significant role in mood and energy levels.\n\n---\n\nStarting recovery is always tough, but integrating these strategies can help create a more positive and focused environment for yourself. This is a common conflict many face when trying to change ingrained behaviors.\n\n### 2. **Habituation**\n   - Over 18 years, your brain has likely adapted to the habit. Your neural pathways are wired to seek that immediate reward, making it harder to break the cycle, even with awareness.\n\n### 3. **Addiction\u2019s Complexity**\n   - Addiction isn\u2019t just about the substance; it often involves emotional, psychological, and social factors. Your brain\u2019s reward system may still prioritize short-term pleasure over long-term health, even when you know better.\n\n### 4. **Stress and Coping Mechanisms**\n   - Long-term habits often serve as coping mechanisms for stress or emotional pain. Even when you know they\u2019re harmful, they can feel like a lifeline during tough times.\n\n### 5. **Fear of Change**\n   - Change can be daunting, and the fear of the unknown can keep you anchored to familiar habits, even if you know they\u2019re not beneficial.\n\n### 6. **Positive Reinforcement**\n   - The immediate benefits of the habit (e.g., feeling good, stress relief) often overshadow the longer-term negatives. This reinforcement can make it tough to break free, despite logical awareness.\n\n### 7. **Identity and Self-Perception**\n   - After years of a certain lifestyle, it can become part of your identity. The idea of changing might feel like losing a part of yourself, even if that part isn\u2019t serving you well.\n\n### Moving Forward\nRecognizing this paradox is an important step. leads to a complete loss of self can be attributed to several factors:\n\n### 1. **Media Representation**\n   - Stories of addiction in media often focus on the most extreme cases, highlighting tragic outcomes without showcasing successful recoveries. This skews public perception.\n\n### 2. **Survivorship Bias**\n   - We often hear from those who struggle the hardest or don\u2019t recover. Those who find clarity and successfully navigate their recovery journeys may remain quieter, not seeking the spotlight.\n\n### 3. **Stigma and Shame**\n   - Many individuals in recovery feel shame or fear judgment, which can prevent them from sharing their stories. This lack of representation can contribute to the belief that recovery is rare.\n\n### 4. **Complex Nature of Addiction**\n   - Addiction affects everyone differently. For many, the brain changes can be profound, leading to a loss of insight or motivation. Those who manage to retain clarity are often exceptions rather than the rule.\n\n### 5. **Cultural Narratives**\n   - Societal narratives often portray addiction as a moral failing rather than a complex condition influenced by biology, psychology, and environment, reinforcing the notion of hopelessness.\n\n### 6. **Lack of Support**\n   - Many people struggling with addiction lack access to resources, support systems, or education that could help them recognize their situation and seek help, leading to a cycle of despair.\n\n### 7. **Isolation**\n   - Addiction can lead to social isolation, making it harder for individuals to see that others experience similar struggles or to learn from those who have found recovery.\n\n### Conclusion\nWhile it may seem that addiction rots the soul, the reality is more nuanced. There are countless stories of resilience and recovery that go untold. "text": "  * 10th X Rare: Powerful cards commemorating the 10th anniversary of Battle Spirits. They have a \"10th\" printed on the card and the card art features gold details.\n\n### Colours\n\n[\u301068\u2020edit\u3011]\n\nThe Battle Spirits world is set with six colours; Red (Ruby), Green (Emerald), Purple (Amethyst), White (Diamond), Blue (Sapphire), and Yellow (Topaz). Each colour stems from a different variety of precious gem. \n\n  * Red: Red cards are mainly in aggressive effects that are activated when the player is attacking. It has many destructive effects that change the game situation drastically. One of the typical cards is \u201cFlame Tempest\u201d. It destroys all spirits with 3000BP or less. The Art for Red spirits are mostly based on Reptiles, Dragons, Dinosaurs and such.\n  * White: White cards are mainly defensive and many have effects that activate when they block. Even when the player have less spirits than opponent does, white spirits will protect player's Life with their strong defensive power. One of the typical cards is \u201cPure Elixir\u201d. It refreshes all exhausted spirits. The Art for White cards are basically Robots or Mechas.\n  * Green: Green cards are good at generating cores in which they can give a player an early resource advantage in the game. An example is \"Potion Berry\". It enables the player to add a core to the reserve. And also it plays around the Refresh and Exhaust which enable them go for opponent's life. Green spirits are mostly based on Nature, Beasts, and insects.\n  * Purple: Purple cards are good at causing pain to the opponent outside of the battle. Purple is notorious for effects that play with the core layout of their opponent, like removing core from opposing Spirits in an attempt to deplete them. They also have many cards which enables the player to draw more. One of the typical cards is \u201cThe Shackles of Doom\u201d. It prohibits spirits with only one core on them from attacking or blocking. Purple spirits are mostly based on death, demons, zombies, snakes and others.\n  * Blue: Blue cards mainly have the power to demolish opponent's deck, focusing on victory by deck out. They also have a high affinity with nexuses, which boost their effects or distract opponent's strategies. One card is \"Magic Hammer\", which allows the player to move the top 5 cards of the opponent's deck to their trash. Blue spirits are mostly based on the superhuman, Chimeras, Golems, and Myths.\n  * Yellow: Yellow cards are weak compared to other colours when looking at cost and BP, but have amazing effects that gives the player a powerful advantage when it comes to magic. Yellow is great at working with other colours to boost the power of their magic. And they have a lot of funny Battle Rule changing cards. Such as BP Matching becomes Level Matching or even treating its attack as if it wasn't blocked. Yellow spirits are mostly based on the divine, and... many cute creatures.\n\n### Card Mechanics\n\n[\u301069\u2020edit\u3011]\n\nThese are keywords that help identify a spirit's effect. All details for the special effects are printed on the cards. \n\nRed's Specialty effects: \n\n  * Awaken [\u899a\u9192](Kakusei): Spirits with Awaken have the effect texts listed as follows: (Flash Step): Player may move any number of cores from other spirits player control to this spirit. This effect is in red.\n\n  * Ultra-Awaken [\u8d85\u899a\u9192](Chou Kakusei): A variation of Awaken where the spirit is refreshed each time cores are placed on it.\n\n  * True-Awaken [\u771f\u899a\u9192]: A variation of Awaken specific to Ultimates where the ultimate gains 3000 BP for every core placed on it.\n\n  * Clash [\u6fc0\u7a81]: Spirits with Clash have the effect texts as follows: (When Attacks): Opponent's spirits must block if possible. This effect is in red.\n\n  * True-Clash [\u771f\u6fc0\u7a81]: A variation of Clash where opposing spirits or ultimates must block if possible.\n\nGreen's Specialty effects: \n\n  * Swift [\u795e\u901f]: Spirits with Swift have the effect texts listed as follows: (Flash Step): This spirit may be summoned from the player's hand during the Flash Step. In that case, the cost of this spirit and cores to be put on this spirit must be paid or moved from the player's Reserve. This effect is in green.\n\n  * Violent Swift [\u70c8\u795e\u901f]: A variation of Swift where the Core Cost is paid from the trash if there are 5 or more in it.\n\n  * Windstorm: X [\u66b4\u98a8\uff1aX]: Spirits with Windstorm have the effect texts as follows: (When Attacks): Each time this spirit is blocked, opponent exhausts the specified number of unexhausted spirits they control. Th", "title": "Battle Spirits - Wikipedia", "tether_id": null}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": null, "weight": 0.0, "metadata": {"_cite_metadata": {"citation_format": {"name": "tether_og"}, "metadata_list": [{"type": "webpage", "title": "Battle Spirits - Wikipedia", "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_Spirits", "text": "  * 10th X Rare: Powerful cards commemorating the 10th anniversary of Battle Spirits. \u301031\u2020PS5\u3011\n  * \u301032\u2020Switch\u3011\n\n#  Battle Spirits CrossOver announced for PS5, Switch, and PC \n\nDue out on November 7 in Japan.\n\n\u301033\u2020Sal Romano\u3011\n\nJun 20 2024 / 6:30 AM EDT\n\n0\n\n[Image 0]\n\n\u301034\u2020FuRyu\u3011 has \u301035\u2020announced\u2020prtimes.jp\u3011 digital card game \u301036\u2020Battle Spirits CrossOver\u3011 for \u301031\u2020PlayStation 5\u3011, \u301032\u2020Switch\u3011, and \u30105\u2020PC\u3011 (Steam). It will launch both physically and digitally on November 7 in Japan for 7,200 yen. \n\nIn Battle Spirits CrossOver, you play the trading card game Battle Spirits with the same rules as the actual card game. It features over 1,900 cards, up to the cards from the \u201cBS68 Contract Saga: True Volume 1 \u2013 Battle of the Gods\u201d set, as well as customization features like sleeves and play sheets, allowing you to enjoy building an original deck to your heart\u2019s content.\n\nThe game also features original stories through which original characters form deeper bonds through Battle Spirits, online battles, and local battles through separate devices for Switch users. There is also a tutorial for Battle Spirits newcomers or players returning after a long time, tag battles in which you battle using two decks, Battleskii quizzes, and plenty of other content for Battle Spirits fans to enjoy.\n\nWatch the teaser trailer below.\n\n## Teaser Trailer\n\n  * \u30102\u2020PlayStation\u3011\n  * \u301031\u2020PS5\u3011\n  * \u30104\u2020Nintendo\u3011\n  * \u301032\u2020Switch\u3011\n  * \u30105\u2020PC\u3011\n  * \u301037\u2020Card\u3011\n\n  * \u301038\u2020Clips\u3011\n  * \u301039\u2020Game Announce\u3011\n  * \u301040\u2020Trailers\u3011\n\nGame Info\n\n## \u301036\u2020Battle Spirits CrossOver\u3011\n\nCompany Profile\n\n## \u301034\u2020FuRyu\u3011\n\n####  Upcoming Events \u301041\u2020View all\u3011 \n\n  * \u301042\u2020 The Crew Showcase 2024 September 10 @ 12:00 pm - 1:00 pm EDT \u3011 \n  * \u301043\u2020 RGG Summit 2024 September 20 @ 6:00 am - 7:00 am EDT \u3011 \n  * \u301044\u2020 Duet Night Abyss Tokyo Game Show 2024 Special Program September 22 @ 6:00 am - 7:30 am EDT \u3011 \n  * \u301045\u2020 LEVEL-5 Vision 2024: To the World\u2019s Children September 24 @ 8:00 am - 9:00 am EDT \u3011 \n\n### What\u2019s Popular\n\n[Image 1]\n\n###### \u301046\u2020Silent Hill 2 remake \u2013 first 90 minutes of gameplay\u3011\n\n[Image 2]\n\n###### \u301047\u2020Yu-Gi-Oh! Gematsu", "url": "https://www.gematsu.com/2024/06/battle-spirits-crossover-announced-for-ps5-switch-and-pc", "text": "      * \u301012\u2020People\u3011\n    * Topics \n      * \u301013\u2020PS5\u3011\n      * \u301014\u2020Xbox Series\u3011\n      * \u301015\u2020Smartphone\u3011\n      * \u301016\u20203DS\u3011\n      * \u301017\u2020PS Vita\u3011\n      * \u301018\u2020Stadia\u3011\n      * \u301019\u2020Interviews\u3011\n      * \u301020\u2020Previews\u3011\n      * \u301021\u2020Arcade\u3011\n      * \u301022\u2020PS3\u3011\n      * \u301023\u2020Xbox 360\u3011\n    * \u301024\u2020Screenshots\u3011\n    * \u301025\u2020Upcoming Events\u3011\n    * \u301026\u2020Open Forum\u3011\n    * Information \n      * \u301027\u2020About\u3011\n      * \u301028\u2020Comment Policy\u3011\n      * \u301029\u2020Follow Us\u3011\n      * \u301030\u2020Privacy Policy\u3011\n\n  * \u30105\u2020PC\u3011\n  * \u301031\u2020PS5\u3011\n  * \u301032\u2020Switch\u3011\n\n#  Battle Spirits CrossOver announced for PS5, Switch, and PC \n\nDue out on November 7 in Japan.\n\n\u301033\u2020Sal Romano\u3011\n\nJun 20 2024 / 6:30 AM EDT\n\n0\n\n[Image 0]\n\n\u301034\u2020FuRyu\u3011 has \u301035\u2020announced\u2020prtimes.jp\u3011 digital card game \u301036\u2020Battle Spirits CrossOver\u3011 for \u301031\u2020PlayStation 5\u3011, \u301032\u2020Switch\u3011, and \u30105\u2020PC\u3011 (Steam). It will launch both physically and digitally on November 7 in Japan for 7,200 yen. \n\nIn Battle Spirits CrossOver, you play the trading card game Battle Spirits with the same rules as the actual card game. It features over 1,900 cards, up to the cards from the \u201cBS68 Contract Saga: True Volume 1 \u2013 Battle of the Gods\u201d set, as well as customization features like sleeves and play sheets, allowing you to enjoy building an original deck to your heart\u2019s content.\n\nThe game also features original stories through which original characters form deeper bonds through Battle Spirits, online battles, and local battles through separate devices for Switch users. There is also a tutorial for Battle Spirits newcomers or players returning after a long time, tag battles in which you battle using two decks, Battleskii quizzes, and plenty of other content for Battle Spirits fans to enjoy.\n\nWatch the teaser trailer below.\n\n## Teaser Trailer\n\n  * \u30102\u2020PlayStation\u3011\n  * \u301031\u2020PS5\u3011\n  * \u30104\u2020Nintendo\u3011\n  * \u301032\u2020Switch\u3011\n  * \u30105\u2020PC\u3011\n  * \u301037\u2020Card\u3011\n\n  * \u301038\u2020Clips\u3011\n  * \u301039\u2020Game Announce\u3011\n  * \u301040\u2020Trailers\u3011\n\nGame Info\n\n## \u301036\u2020Battle Spirits CrossOver\u3011\n\nCompany Profile\n\n## \u301034\u2020FuRyu\u3011\n\n####  Upcoming Events \u301041\u2020View all\u3011 \n\n  * \u301042\u2020 The Crew Showcase 2024 September 10 @ 12:00 pm - 1:00 pm EDT \u3011 \n  * \u301043\u2020 RGG Summit 2024 September 20 @ 6:00 am - 7:00 am EDT \u3011 \n  * \u301044\u2020 Duet Night Abyss Tokyo Game Show 2024 Special Program September 22 @ 6:00 am - 7:30 am EDT \u3011 \n  * \u301045\u2020 LEVEL-5 Vision 2024: To the World\u2019s Children September 24 @ 8:00 am - 9:00 am EDT \u3011 \n\n### What\u2019s Popular\n\n[Image 1]\n\n###### \u301046\u2020Silent Hill 2 remake \u2013 first 90 minutes of gameplay\u3011\n\n[Image 2]\n\n###### \u301047\u2020Yu-Gi-Oh! As of 2024, it's still heavily focused on the trading card game, with new releases and digital expansions. Notably, a new digital card game, *Battle Spirits CrossOver*, is set to launch in November 2024 for PS5, Switch, and PC, showing continued growth in its gaming sector\u301011\u2020source\u3011\u301012\u2020source\u3011.\n\nThere was also a 15th-anniversary short anime in 2023 that brought characters from different series within the *Battle Spirits* universe together, highlighting that the franchise is still being celebrated and supported with new content\u301013\u2020source\u3011.\n\nIf you\u2019re planning to market your gummies with *Battle Spirits* characters or storylines, you'd need to reach out to Sunrise or Bandai, as they handle the IP for the anime and trading card game. A good approach would be to express your interest in a licensing deal, outlining your product and how you'd incorporate their characters in your marketing while aligning with their brand image.\n\n"]}, "status": "finished_successfully", "end_turn": true, "weight": 1.0, "metadata": {"citations": [{"start_ix": 333, "end_ix": 344, "citation_format_type": "tether_og", "metadata": {"type": "webpage", "title": "Battle Spirits - Wikipedia", "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_Spirits", "text": "  * 10th X Rare: Powerful cards commemorating the 10th anniversary of Battle Spirits. They have a \"10th\" printed on the card and the card art features gold details.\n\n### Colours\n\n[\u301068\u2020edit\u3011]\n\nThe Battle Spirits world is set with six colours; Red (Ruby), Green (Emerald), Purple (Amethyst), White (Diamond), Blue (Sapphire), and Yellow (Topaz). Each colour stems from a different variety of precious gem. \n\n  * Red: Red cards are mainly in aggressive effects that are activated when the player is attacking. It has many destructive effects that change the game situation drastically. One of the typical cards is \u201cFlame Tempest\u201d. It destroys all spirits with 3000BP or less. The Art for Red spirits are mostly based on Reptiles, Dragons, Dinosaurs and such.\n  * White: White cards are mainly defensive and many have effects that activate when they block. Even when the player have less spirits than opponent does, white spirits will protect player's Life with their strong defensive power. One of the typical cards is \u201cPure Elixir\u201d. It refreshes all exhausted spirits. The Art for White cards are basically Robots or Mechas.\n  * Green: Green cards are good at generating cores in which they can give a player an early resource advantage in the game. An example is \"Potion Berry\". It enables the player to add a core to the reserve. And also it plays around the Refresh and Exhaust which enable them go for opponent's life. Green spirits are mostly based on Nature, Beasts, and insects.\n  * Purple: Purple cards are good at causing pain to the opponent outside of the battle. Purple is notorious for effects that play with the core layout of their opponent, like removing core from opposing Spirits in an attempt to deplete them. They also have many cards which enables the player to draw more. One of the typical cards is \u201cThe Shackles of Doom\u201d. It prohibits spirits with only one core on them from attacking or blocking. Purple spirits are mostly based on death, demons, zombies, snakes and others.\n  * Blue: Blue cards mainly have the power to demolish opponent's deck, focusing on victory by deck out. They also have a high affinity with nexuses, which boost their effects or distract opponent's strategies. One card is \"Magic Hammer\", which allows the player to move the top 5 cards of the opponent's deck to their trash. Blue spirits are mostly based on the superhuman, Chimeras, Golems, and Myths.\n  * Yellow: Yellow cards are weak compared to other colours when looking at cost and BP, but have amazing effects that gives the player a powerful advantage when it comes to magic. Yellow is great at working with other colours to boost the power of their magic. And they have a lot of funny Battle Rule changing cards. Such as BP Matching becomes Level Matching or even treating its attack as if it wasn't blocked. Yellow spirits are mostly based on the divine, and... many cute creatures.\n\n### Card Mechanics\n\n[\u301069\u2020edit\u3011]\n\nThese are keywords that help identify a spirit's effect. All details for the special effects are printed on the cards. \n\nRed's Specialty effects: \n\n  * Awaken [\u899a\u9192](Kakusei): Spirits with Awaken have the effect texts listed as follows: (Flash Step): Player may move any number of cores from other spirits player control to this spirit. This effect is in red.\n\n  * Ultra-Awaken [\u8d85\u899a\u9192](Chou Kakusei): A variation of Awaken where the spirit is refreshed each time cores are placed on it.\n\n  * True-Awaken [\u771f\u899a\u9192]: A variation of Awaken specific to Ultimates where the ultimate gains 3000 BP for every core placed on it.\n\n  * Clash [\u6fc0\u7a81]: Spirits with Clash have the effect texts as follows: (When Attacks): Opponent's spirits must block if possible. This effect is in red.\n\n  * True-Clash [\u771f\u6fc0\u7a81]: A variation of Clash where opposing spirits or ultimates must block if possible.\n\nGreen's Specialty effects: \n\n  * Swift [\u795e\u901f]: Spirits with Swift have the effect texts listed as follows: (Flash Step): This spirit may be summoned from the player's hand during the Flash Step. In that case, the cost of this spirit and cores to be put on this spirit must be paid or moved from the player's Reserve. This effect is in green.\n\n  * Violent Swift [\u70c8\u795e\u901f]: A variation of Swift where the Core Cost is paid from the trash if there are 5 or more in it.\n\n  * Windstorm: X [\u66b4\u98a8\uff1aX]: Spirits with Windstorm have the effect texts as follows: (When Attacks): Each time this spirit is blocked, opponent exhausts the specified number of unexhausted spirits they control. Th", "pub_date": null, "extra": {"cited_message_idx": 11, "search_result_idx": null, "evidence_text": "source", "cloud_doc_url": null}}}, {"start_ix": 344, "end_ix": 355, "citation_format_type": "tether_og", "metadata": {"type": "webpage", "title": "Battle Spirits CrossOver announced for PS5, Switch, and PC - Gematsu", "url": "https://www.gematsu.com/2024/06/battle-spirits-crossover-announced-for-ps5-switch-and-pc", "text": "      * \u301012\u2020People\u3011\n    * Topics \n      * \u301013\u2020PS5\u3011\n      * \u301014\u2020Xbox Series\u3011\n      * \u301015\u2020Smartphone\u3011\n      * \u301016\u20203DS\u3011\n      * \u301017\u2020PS Vita\u3011\n      * \u301018\u2020Stadia\u3011\n      * \u301019\u2020Interviews\u3011\n      * \u301020\u2020Previews\u3011\n      * \u301021\u2020Arcade\u3011\n      * \u301022\u2020PS3\u3011\n      * \u301023\u2020Xbox 360\u3011\n    * \u301024\u2020Screenshots\u3011\n    * \u301025\u2020Upcoming Events\u3011\n    * \u301026\u2020Open Forum\u3011\n    * Information \n      * \u301027\u2020About\u3011\n      * \u301028\u2020Comment Policy\u3011\n      * \u301029\u2020Follow Us\u3011\n      * \u301030\u2020Privacy Policy\u3011\n\n  * \u30105\u2020PC\u3011\n  * \u301031\u2020PS5\u3011\n  * \u301032\u2020Switch\u3011\n\n#  Battle Spirits CrossOver announced for PS5, Switch, and PC \n\nDue out on November 7 in Japan.\n\n\u301033\u2020Sal Romano\u3011\n\nJun 20 2024 / 6:30 AM EDT\n\n0\n\n[Image 0]\n\n\u301034\u2020FuRyu\u3011 has \u301035\u2020announced\u2020prtimes.jp\u3011 digital card game \u301036\u2020Battle Spirits CrossOver\u3011 for \u301031\u2020PlayStation 5\u3011, \u301032\u2020Switch\u3011, and \u30105\u2020PC\u3011 (Steam). It will launch both physically and digitally on November 7 in Japan for 7,200 yen. \n\nIn Battle Spirits CrossOver, you play the trading card game Battle Spirits with the same rules as the actual card game. It features over 1,900 cards, up to the cards from the \u201cBS68 Contract Saga: True Volume 1 \u2013 Battle of the Gods\u201d set, as well as customization features like sleeves and play sheets, allowing you to enjoy building an original deck to your heart\u2019s content.\n\nThe game also features original stories through which original characters form deeper bonds through Battle Spirits, online battles, and local battles through separate devices for Switch users. There is also a tutorial for Battle Spirits newcomers or players returning after a long time, tag battles in which you battle using two decks, Battleskii quizzes, and plenty of other content for Battle Spirits fans to enjoy.\n\nWatch the teaser trailer below.\n\n## Teaser Trailer\n\n  * \u30102\u2020PlayStation\u3011\n  * \u301031\u2020PS5\u3011\n  * \u30104\u2020Nintendo\u3011\n  * \u301032\u2020Switch\u3011\n  * \u30105\u2020PC\u3011\n  * \u301037\u2020Card\u3011\n\n  * \u301038\u2020Clips\u3011\n  * \u301039\u2020Game Announce\u3011\n  * \u301040\u2020Trailers\u3011\n\nGame Info\n\n## \u301036\u2020Battle Spirits CrossOver\u3011\n\nCompany Profile\n\n## \u301034\u2020FuRyu\u3011\n\n####  Upcoming Events \u301041\u2020View all\u3011 \n\n  * \u301042\u2020 The Crew Showcase 2024 September 10 @ 12:00 pm - 1:00 pm EDT \u3011 \n  * \u301043\u2020 RGG Summit 2024 September 20 @ 6:00 am - 7:00 am EDT \u3011 \n  * \u301044\u2020 Duet Night Abyss Tokyo Game Show 2024 Special Program September 22 @ 6:00 am - 7:30 am EDT \u3011 \n  * \u301045\u2020 LEVEL-5 Vision 2024: To the World\u2019s Children September 24 @ 8:00 am - 9:00 am EDT \u3011 \n\n### What\u2019s Popular\n\n[Image 1]\n\n###### \u301046\u2020Silent Hill 2 remake \u2013 first 90 minutes of gameplay\u3011\n\n[Image 2]\n\n###### \u301047\u2020Yu-Gi-Oh! They challenge each other to a card battle, using the new keiyaku (contract) cards.\n\n\u301062\u2020Edit\u3011\n\n## Background \n\nThis short anime celebrates the 15th anniversary of the \"Battle Spirits\" franchise.  \n\n\u301063\u2020Edit\u3011\n\n## Related Entries\n\nParent Story: \n\n  * \u301064\u2020Battle Spirits: Shounen Toppa Bashin\u3011 (TV)\n  * \u301065\u2020Saikyou Ginga Ultimate Zero: Battle Spirits\u3011 (TV)\n\n## \n\n\u301066\u2020Visit MALxJapan\u2020mxj.myanimelist.net\u3011 \n\nMALxJapan -More than just anime-\n\n\u301067\u2020 Kinnikuman: Perfect Origin Arc Quick Quiz Giveaway \u2020mxj.myanimelist.net\u3011 \u301068\u2020 Learn how to draw anime & manga from Japanese pros \u2020mxj.myanimelist.net\u3011 \u301069\u2020 Check out colleize \u30fc big catalog, rare items and worldwide shipping! \u2020mxj.myanimelist.net\u3011   \n\n\u301051\u2020More characters\u3011\n\n## Characters & Voice Actors \n\nNo characters or voice actors have been added to this title. AutoRec\u3011\n  * \u301089\u2020JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken Part 3: Stardust Crusaders AutoRec\u3011\n  * \u301090\u2020Tensei shitara Slime Datta Ken AutoRec\u3011\n  * \u301091\u2020Tokyo Revengers AutoR", "pub_date": null, "extra": {"cited_message_idx": 13, "search_result_idx": null, "evidence_text": "source", "cloud_doc_url": null}}}], "content_references": [{"matched_text": "\u301011\u2020source\u3011", "start_idx": 333, "end_idx": 344, "alt": null, "type": "webpage_extended", "title": "Battle Spirits - Wikipedia", "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_Spirits", "pub_date": null, "snippet": "  * 10th X Rare: Powerful cards commemorating the 10th anniversary of Battle Spirits. They have a \"10th\" printed on the card and the card art features gold details.\n\n### Colours\n\n[\u301068\u2020edit\u3011]\n\nThe Battle Spirits world is set with six colours; Red (Ruby), Green (Emerald), Purple (Amethyst), White (Diamond), Blue (Sapphire), and Yellow (Topaz). Each colour stems from a different variety of precious gem. \n\n  * Red: Red cards are mainly in aggressive effects that are activated when the player is attacking. It has many destructive effects that change the game situation drastically. One of the typical cards is \u201cFlame Tempest\u201d. It destroys all spirits with 3000BP or less. The Art for Red spirits are mostly based on Reptiles, Dragons, Dinosaurs and such.\n  * White: White cards are mainly defensive and many have effects that activate when they block. Even when the player have less spirits than opponent does, white spirits will protect player's Life with their strong defensive power. One of the typical cards is \u201cPure Elixir\u201d. It refreshes all exhausted spirits. The Art for White cards are basically Robots or Mechas.\n  * Green: Green cards are good at generating cores in which they can give a player an early resource advantage in the game. An example is \"Potion Berry\". It enables the player to add a core to the reserve. And also it plays around the Refresh and Exhaust which enable them go for opponent's life. Green spirits are mostly based on Nature, Beasts, and insects.\n  * Purple: Purple cards are good at causing pain to the opponent outside of the battle. Purple is notorious for effects that play with the core layout of their opponent, like removing core from opposing Spirits in an attempt to deplete them. They also have many cards which enables the player to draw more. One of the typical cards is \u201cThe Shackles of Doom\u201d. It prohibits spirits with only one core on them from attacking or blocking. Purple spirits are mostly based on death, demons, zombies, snakes and others.\n  * Blue: Blue cards mainly have the power to demolish opponent's deck, focusing on victory by deck out. They also have a high affinity with nexuses, which boost their effects or distract opponent's strategies. One card is \"Magic Hammer\", which allows the player to move the top 5 cards of the opponent's deck to their trash. Blue spirits are mostly based on the superhuman, Chimeras, Golems, and Myths.\n  * Yellow: Yellow cards are weak compared to other colours when looking at cost and BP, but have amazing effects that gives the player a powerful advantage when it comes to magic. Yellow is great at working with other colours to boost the power of their magic. And they have a lot of funny Battle Rule changing cards. Such as BP Matching becomes Level Matching or even treating its attack as if it wasn't blocked. Yellow spirits are mostly based on the divine, and... many cute creatures.\n\n### Card Mechanics\n\n[\u301069\u2020edit\u3011]\n\nThese are keywords that help identify a spirit's effect. All details for the special effects are printed on the cards. \n\nRed's Specialty effects: \n\n  * Awaken [\u899a\u9192](Kakusei): Spirits with Awaken have the effect texts listed as follows: (Flash Step): Player may move any number of cores from other spirits player control to this spirit. This effect is in red.\n\n  * Ultra-Awaken [\u8d85\u899a\u9192](Chou Kakusei): A variation of Awaken where the spirit is refreshed each time cores are placed on it.\n\n  * True-Awaken [\u771f\u899a\u9192]: A variation of Awaken specific to Ultimates where the ultimate gains 3000 BP for every core placed on it.\n\n  * Clash [\u6fc0\u7a81]: Spirits with Clash have the effect texts as follows: (When Attacks): Opponent's spirits must block if possible. This effect is in red.\n\n  * True-Clash [\u771f\u6fc0\u7a81]: A variation of Clash where opposing spirits or ultimates must block if possible.\n\nGreen's Specialty effects: \n\n  * Swift [\u795e\u901f]: Spirits with Swift have the effect texts listed as follows: (Flash Step): This spirit may be summoned from the player's hand during the Flash Step. In that case, the cost of this spirit and cores to be put on this spirit must be paid or moved from the player's Reserve. This effect is in green.\n\n  * Violent Swift [\u70c8\u795e\u901f]: A variation of Swift where the Core Cost is paid from the trash if there are 5 or more in it.\n\n  * Windstorm: X [\u66b4\u98a8\uff1aX]: Spirits with Windstorm have the effect texts as follows: (When Attacks): Each time this spirit is blocked, opponent exhausts the specified number of unexhausted spirits they control.
